item.title: China Could Have an Advanced Nuclear Reactor Next Year
item.description: Two high-temperature, gas-cooled reactors under construction in Shandong will make up the first commercial-scale plant of its type in the world.

item.title: After Losing His Wife to Cancer, Google Exec Jeff Huber Will Lead DNA Testing Venture
item.description: Jeff Huber’s wife died of colon cancer. As the head of Grail, he is on a mission to develop a kind of blood test that could have saved her.

item.title: Google’s Self-Driving AI Counts as a “Driver,” According to the Feds
item.description: A letter to Google from the NHTSA, which regulates American roadways, clears a significant hurdle to getting driverless cars on the road.

item.title: Oculus Founder Says He’s Focused on Time, Money Spent on VR Content
item.description: With its first consumer headset, Oculus’s Palmer Luckey will be watching how much people use it and how much they spend on content for it.

item.title: Supreme Court Strikes Blow Against Obama’s Climate Agenda
item.description: Ending a run of good news for clean energy, justices delayed emissions regulations while a legal battle plays out.

item.title: Why the Policy Fight over Encryption Is at an Impasse
item.description: The next U.S. government looks set to inherit the ongoing fight over whether the government should rein in encryption.

item.title: What Obama’s Cybersecurity Strategy Leaves Out
item.description: In two new executive orders, the president makes no explicit mention of fighting terror and limits his administration’s privacy goals.

item.title: Top U.S. Intelligence Official Calls Gene Editing a WMD Threat
item.description: Easy to use. Hard to control. The intelligence community now sees CRISPR as a threat to national safety.

item.title: DARPA’s New Neural Implant Has a Sneaky Way of Getting Inside Heads
item.description: Researchers implanted a “stentrode” to record activity in the brains of live sheep without having to cut open their skulls.

item.title: Connect with Experts to Plan for the Risks of Interconnected Devices
item.description: While the Internet of Things (IoT) has spurred the development of innovative new monitoring technologies, hospitals, device manufacturers and other stakeholders face numerous complex challenges and risks. Proactively adopting a risk management strategy can help support innovation by preventing and reducing financial loss and liability.
